title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3 CHILD-RESPONSIVE BUDGETS

description.narrative: 4.3 Social sector ministries and sub-national governments have the capacity to develop and implement child-responsive budgets, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Sri Lanka, including the most deprived, have their human rights protected and benefit from effective child-sensitive social protection system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.3 Social sector ministries and sub-national governments have the capacity to develop and implement child-responsive budgets

description.narrative: UNICEF’s public finance work supported a significant increase in budget for nutrition-sensitive social protection for 2022, with new allocations of Rs. 1 billion for nutrition support for pregnant mothers and Rs. 15 billion to poor families who are food insecure. This has been a result of UNICEF’s strategic advocacy utilizing evidence that has been generated over the past year. At a decentralized level, UNICEF’s Child Friendly Cities Initiative was successful inleveraging local resources for children, having led to the creation of a permanent expenditure category in the municipal budget with dedicated allocation of Rs. 2 billion in 2021. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022
